values:
This is definitely not a sign of paranoia. Who really wants the people they know in real life reading their lj? Thus... by ABOUT ME

I detest gender roles and am proud to be an only child of a single mother.

The following paragraph was extracted from a Sailor Moon fansite describing Aquarians. The description fits me quite well although I do not subscribe to astrology: Aquarians are very interesting people who are always very strong-willed. They are opinionated and strong in their convictions - they will fight vehemently for what they believe in, but will have little trouble changing their opinion if shown facts on the contrary. They are known to be frank and outspoken - prone to an "on my mind, on my mouth" personality. They are quick in mind, and equally quick to respond. Aquarians are extremely independent. They cherish their independence, and appreciate opportunities to be alone. They enjoy their own company and are rejuvenated by quiet time. Although they are very likable, they are also quite difficult to get close to. They are personable, serious, genial, warm, kind, and outgoing - the sort of people who make friends willingly and eagerly. On the other hand, they do not actively seek out relationships, and resent any infringement on their time or resources. They are a strange mixture of concern and detachment - they are engaging yet unreachable. They will go out of their way to help when needed, but never get emotionally involved. They love mankind and will do anything for the masses - but they have little emotional appreciation for the individual. Aquarians are intelligent people with excellent imaginations. They are very intuitive and innovative, and always have an eye and ear on new things. They change their minds quickly and are always coming up with new and unusual ideas. They often come up with new ideas to provide a solution for problems, without fully thinking through the details of the solution. Aquarians are drawn to and inspired by great causes. They can become so dedicated to a cause that they drive themselves to complete exhaustion, even physical injury. Their convictions are very strong, and they seek truth above all things. They are prone to extreme eccentricity, and are sometimes unwilling to participate in any standard of protocol - they are rarely content being followers. When angered, they can alternate between deafening silence and sudden outbursts of temper. They are very capable of sustained anger and hard feelings, and will tune out the offender, retreating into their own private worlds. They can sometimes show immense, passionate hatred towards foes, and which will not be relieved until the Aquarian himself is ready. They are, however, generally without prejudice, and quite tolerant of the point of view of others. They will see a valid argument even if they disagree with it.

Quotes: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it - Aristotle I'd kill for a Nobel Peace Prize. Borrow money from pessimists - they don't expect it back. A clear conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory. The Earth Is Full - Go Home. None of us are virgins, life has screwed us all. I'm going to live life or die trying. Parents can tell but never teach, unless they practice what they preach. You may only be one person to the world, but you may also be the world to one person. If you think education is expensive, try ignorance. Shared joy is double joy, and shared sorrow is half-sorrow. -Swedish Proverb You cannot discover new oceans unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore. Opportunity may knock only once, but temptation leans on the doorbell. All love that has not friendship for its base is like a mansion built upon sand. -Ella Wheeler Wilcox I built a wall; not to block anyone out, but to see who loves me enough to climb over it. A great fear in life is not having a big enough impact on someone else's life to always be remembered. Don't tell me the sky's the limit when there's footprints on the moon. Never sell for money what you can't buy back with money. If a statistician had her hair on fire and her feet in a block of ice, she would say that 'on the average' she felt good. If you don't stand for something, you will fall for everything. There's fewer more distressing sights than that of an Englishman in a baseball cap. "The limits of my language mean the limit of my world" ~ Wittgenstein Foreign places yield more to one who is himself worth meeting. -Beowulf Life is a sexually transmitted disease. ICON SECTION

So, according to this source, TwiCon Breaking News: Stephenie Meyer to Have Her Own Comic Book. The creative force behind The Twilight Saga, Stephenie Meyer has been selected for membership into a very exclusive club. Joining the ranks of Michelle Obama, Oprah Winfrey, and Princess Diana, Meyer will be immortalized in the comic book series Female Force. Bluewater Productions, the publisher behind the Female Force series, aims for the comics to offer "a broad examination of strong and influential women who are shaping modern history and culture." Stephenie Meyer's comic book treatment will "tell her story in a very fun, respectful, and unique way," says Bluewater's President Darren G. Davis. What this world is coming to, I don't know. This warrants an epic ONTD. What's shameful is that they announce this on JKR/Harry's birthday of all days. With pleasure I present to you Blogging Twilight. One of the Sparknotes editors is cringingly reading the entire series but making it worthwhile with hilarious commentary. This way you have the delight of being extra well-informed so as to partake in the criticisms without the taxing burden of having to actually read Stephenie Meyer's work. I promise you laughs. Speaking of properly honouring Harry Potter, I watched A Very Potter Musical. I honestly can't believe I lived three weeks without knowing about it. Not only is this play brilliant but it has Broadway potential. AVPM reaffirmed my love of Draco and had me genuinely bursting with laughter. It's too good to spoil but I can say that I hope the soundtrack does come to light. Oh, now I'll have to find icons referencing AVPM.

There we have it. If it's one person the world will break the internet for, it's MJ the Legend. I'm not sad, but I am stunned that King of Pop died at 50. Rather young with what was to be an epic tour ahead. I heard about the cardiac arrest first, and my mum went "Imagine if MJ died" to which I responded "That would be so wrong. It would induce mass hysteria". My mother is a terribly inconvenient prophet. As an avid music listener, I just wanna say I WANT MY ICON BACK. P.S. I REALLY want Glambert to make an icon of himself someday for my generation because no one else will restore our already non-existent standards of popular music at the rate we're going.

Except when it comes to Sarah Palin. I would prefer her to be as far away from Washington as possible. The 2008 elections are turning into such a soap opera (i.e. Paris Hilton pwning McCain and Palin's pregnant teenage daughter; small town values/morals, huh?). A historically intriguing soap opera that will never play itself out again like this and I have to make the most of it. Records are being broken left and right; Wikipedia points out the cool trivia:
  • It is the first time in U.S. history that two sitting senators will run against each other for president.
  • It is the first time an African American is a presidential nominee for a major party.
  • The first time both major candidates were born outside the continental United States - Hawaii for Obama and the Panama Canal Zone (Coco Solo, a US naval base) for McCain.
  • It is the first time a female VP candidate is nominated for the GOP and second time for a major party.
  • It is the first time since the 1928 election in which neither an incumbent President nor an incumbent Vice President ran for their party's nomination in the presidential election.
  • It is the first time since the 1952 election that neither the incumbent President nor incumbent Vice President is a candidate in the general election.
  • It is the first in which the Vice President is not a candidate for either the presidency or the vice presidency since Nelson Rockefeller in 1976.
  • It is virtually the first time since the election of John F. Kennedy in 1960 that a sitting Senator will be elected President of the United States, and only the third time ever in American history, after John F. Kennedy and Warren G. Harding.
  • New states: If elected, either Obama would be the first president from Hawaii or McCain would be the first president from Arizona.
  • Also, if inaugurated on January 20, 2009, McCain would be the oldest U.S. president upon ascension to the presidency at age 72 years and 144 days, and the second-oldest president to be inaugurated (Ronald Reagan was 73 years and 350 days old at his second inauguration).
  • Barack Obama and John McCain are 24 years and 340 days apart in age. This is the largest age disparity between the two major party presidential candidates, surpassing Bill Clinton and Bob Dole (23 years and 28 days apart in age) who ran against each other in 1996.
  • This is also the first Presidential election since 1976, and only the fourth since the American Civil War, in which none of the four nominees for President and Vice-President from the two major parties have ties of birth or political office to any of the three most populous states in the Union (New York, Texas, or California). [Obama=Hawaii-Illinois, McCain=Panama-Arizona, Biden=Pennsylvania-Delaware, Palin=Idaho-Alaska]
  • Obama is the first presidential candidate to have been given honorary membership into a Native American tribe, the Crow Nation.
 A concise argument as to why experience shouldn't mean everything for Obama As soon as I heard about McCain's running mate selection, I had to raise an eyebrow. What exactly is this man up to? I mean, it is downright insulting if he thinks he can rally off Hilary's disgruntled feminist voters by presenting a Republican in a skirt. As Joe Biden points out, Clinton and Palin are diametrically opposed in their politics, but the disheartening thing about it all is that yes, some voters will fall for this low and dirty tactic. Other than the Palin being a woman issue, there's also the fact that the Republicans are ruthless hypocrites. They just love bashing Obama for his callowness in the federal government scene yet they endorse Palin in an almost blinded and unquestioning matter and HER lack of experience. Is McCain Pushing His Luck? Leaving ideologies on how to govern the nation aside, I can not stress the practical matters enough, especially in terms of McCain's ever growing and salient impermanence. Given his age, McCain could very well be leaving the Oval Office to a person that doesn't even know what a VP does [Source]. I ask you, what the hell is wrong with this country? The Word from Wasilla provides an up close and personal account of what type of politician and person Palin is. She's a former beauty queen-turned-sportscaster with a degree in journalism who served as mayor for a town of 9,000 people. She's been governor for the same length of time Obama's been campaigning for president. She's pro-life even in cases of rape, incest, and risk to health of the mother. She supports teaching creationism in public schools, (my stance on this is that intelligent design should only be taught in a religious study course. It has no place in a science curriculum, however.) as well as abstinence, but doesn't favour explicit sex-ed programmes. During her mayoralty, Palin tried to fire the local librarian because she wouldn't adhere to Palin's demand of book censorship. A book banner! That Bridge to Nowhere: Palin accepted it at first and then kept the federal funds after her solid "no thanks". She opposed the Alaska Clean Water Act??? Northwestern hick Moose-hunter Palin favoured the Alaska Department of Fish Game policy that allows wolf-hunting from helicopters to increase moose and caribou populations by protecting them from "predators". That way people can hunt more moose and caribou. She continues to deny the endangered species status of both polar bears and beluga whales despite scientific opinion. She raised taxes to construct a budget for the $14.7 million Wasilla Multi-Use Sports Complex for which there was a $1.3 million eminent domain lawsuit loss. She left Wasilla with a $22 million debt, by the way. There's also been some gubernatorial power abuse with firing Wasilla's Police Chief since he wouldn't fire a certain State Trooper, incidentally her former brother-in-law. Is it just me or does it sound like Palin wants Ukraine and Georgia to join NATO in order to go to war with Russia? PLUS she totally has foreign policy experience because, despite having only obtained a passport AND left the country for the first time just last year to visit a U.S. military base in Kuwait, Fox News seriously likes to make a point of how Palin lives close to Russia therefore she is instantly qualified. The Republican ticket is made of so much fail right now, the party's turned into a joke. Now I really believe anyone can run for president. This is change you can believe in, guys! FYI, Community Organisers do have responsibilities. And WTF is a hockey mom?

This is an article I found in the Vertical Files while I was doing my regular Friday intern research. I thought it might particularly interest and maybe as well . It caught my attention after having read When Christ and His Saints Slept. Sharon Kay Penman writes epically long books with some thorough research involved. It's sad that three years went down the drain when she lost that draft. I would've freaked out although knowing me, it's likely I would've kept a back up copy. 'Tis easier with the magical copy and paste feature of today's technology. I did not know Penman is from Jersey, by the way. I feel enlightened and oddly geographically proud.

About three things I am absolutely positive.
First, Jane Austen must be rolling in her grave.
Second, there is a part of me--
and I don't know how dominant that part might be--
that thirsts for masochism.
And third, I am unconditionally and irrevocably
in love with the insanity that is the Twilight fandom:

With the general exception of the protagonists, Jane Austen's characters tend to be skeletal as readers only have other characters' generic descriptions of their virtues and merits to go on, but Meyer has the distinct honour of creating characters that are, in a literary sense, borderline anorexic. Don't fret, my dears, for the satirical fandomers have stepped in to give you:
The highly recommended cracktastic Cullen-centric version of Twilight

It has quotable character development. Oh, and if you care to bear witness to more of the monstrosity (pun intended, of course), then have a go at it with some level-headed analysis of New Moon.

"When you read the book," says Pattinson, looking appropriately pallid and interesting even without makeup, "it's like, 'Edward Cullen was so beautiful I creamed myself.' I mean, every line is like that. He's the most ridiculous person who's so amazing at everything. I think a lot of actors tried to play that aspect. I just couldn't do that. And the more I read the script, the more I hated this guy, so that's how I played him, as a manic-depressive who hates himself. Plus, he's a 108-year-old virgin so he's obviously got some issues there."
Source: Empire magazine scans on the film

When you were cast and read the book did you think, “Well I’m really beautiful so I’ll be good at this?”

Pattinson: No, I mean that’s kind of why I was kind of tortured before the casting. I read the book and was like “Well this is really dumb I’ll never ever… this is so pointless going up for the role.” Which is what a lot of the fans said, after I was initially cast. They were like “He wasn’t even on the shortlist!” It is kind of weird. I’ve spent a long time thinking, “How can I take the whole beautiful thing as an interpretation?" And I realized that it’s just Bella saying he’s so beautiful and she’s just in love with him and obsessed with him so he could be like a piece of cheese and she would think the same thing.
Source

Robert Pattinson, or rpattz as they now oddly call him now, totally has my respect. He wins so much he deserves a cookie. May Cedric Diggory rest in peace knowing that, however dead or undead he's become, he's a pretty boy with intelligence who PWNS Edward Cullen.

///---The pictorial duel that brilliantly and adequately portrays and settles the antagonism between the Harry Potter and Twilight fandoms once and for all---///

  and I did discuss how we do not let works of fiction influence us and rightly so, but the frightening point I was getting across about the impressionable fangirls proves itself quite well on its own: Who wants to be like Bella?

What's the worst thing you could say to a Twilight fan?

Here's some snigger-worthy statements, verbatim : I know i mean honestly, do ppl even care about trying not to make us mad?????

i feel ur pain... my parents told me edward wasn't real...

I keep saying that I want to be a vampire and my mom's like "they don't exist" it makes me angry.

the worst thing anyone has said about twilight around me,is "that book sux." I was angry.I was like "DOES NOT!" and they were like "whatever." and walked away.it made me furious.

Their fandom is finally falling apart at the seams:

Believe it or not, even some of the twihards saw the light once they read Breaking Dawn. It's tragic enough to say that Twilight itself is the best volume in the saga, but now some the very same fandomers find Stephenie Meyer's ideas poignantly repugnant to the extent that they are organising protests in the form of book burnings and returning the novel to stores.

Yes, they even wrote a petition against Breaking Dawn.

In light of the educated mutiny following the release of Breaking Dawn, leading forum Twilight Lexicon transforms into a dictatorship marked by dishing out an oppressive manifesto. Tenets #2, 3, 6, & 7 are the lulziest bullsh*t.

Someone did have the sagacity to openly and actively albeit radically express his right to freedom of speech by hacking the Lexicon boards.
http://www.twilightlexicon.com/yes_our_boards_were_hacked.htm

The delectable icing on the cake:

Stephenie Meyer addresses the leakage of Midnight Sun [Excerpt]
Source
As some of you may have heard, my partial draft of Midnight Sun was illegally posted on the Internet and has since been virally distributed without my knowledge or permission or the knowledge or permission of my publisher.

I have a good idea of how the leak happened as there were very few copies of Midnight Sun that left my possession and each was unique. Due to little changes I made to the manuscript at different times, I can tell when each left my possession and to whom it was given. The manuscript that was illegally distributed on the Internet was given to trusted individuals for a good purpose.

I did not want my readers to experience Midnight Sun before it was completed, edited and published. I think it is important for everybody to understand that what happened was a huge violation of my rights as an author, not to mention me as a human being.

So where does this leave Midnight Sun? My first feeling was that there was no way to continue. Writing isn't like math; in math, two plus two always equals four no matter what your mood is like. With writing, the way you feel changes everything. If I tried to write Midnight Sun now, in my current frame of mind, James would probably win and all the Cullens would die, which wouldn't dovetail too well with the original story. In any case, I feel too sad about what has happened to continue working on Midnight Sun, and so it is on hold indefinitely.

I'd rather my fans not read this version of Midnight Sun. It was only an incomplete draft; the writing is messy and flawed and full of mistakes.

Hmm, it's too easy to take a derogatory stab at this, too easy. Let the bold font resound without my colourful commentary. Suffice it to say that this fandom's weak foundation has gloriously collapsed. I am one step closer to dying happily.

P.S. Imagine if Robert Pattinson is the culprit? XDXD

P.S.S. My verbal assault on this series in my last post gave to many the impression that I despise Twilight and all it stands for. I will neither confirm nor deny this interpretation for now. Keep in mind that I am a masochist and that is post is a classic case of my practising schadenfreude.

Okay, I just read Twlight. 

Rating: Epic Fail

I couldn't  go on any longer without knowing what the big fuss was about. I head it being compared to Harry Potter, but then again, I also heard some negative reviews roaming around that were supposed to enlighten me. Being forewarned, I knew I was gonna read it for the lolz, but I tried to keep an open mind as I cracked open the book. ZOMG, this book is so bad it needs entirely new leet, netspeak, and lolcat acronyms altogether. I've read tons of book in my lifetime, and Twilight is hands-down the worse book I've ever read. HOW THE HELL DID THIS THING
GET PUBLISHED??? Never mind that the non-existent plot is suicidal. The story itself reads like bad fanfiction. I don't even want to get into the content involving misogynistic undertones and pansy sparkly vampires. It's bad enough that Stephenie Meyer butchered a kickass mythical creature of the night, but she just had to go on and on about Edward's THE PRETTEH and THE SPARKLEZ. As for Bella, well, I refuse to acknowledge your Mary-Sue ass in the world of fandom.

Stephenie Meyer, you and your fanbase are making me lose further faith in the human race.

In hindsight, I read it for the WTF NO WAI EPIC LULZ factor. I would do a proper review but that would require me to waste more precious time on this rubbish and travesty of a literary work. I can not get those hours of reading back, but I have made the time worthwhile by finding some quality ridicule on the subject matter. Plenty of readers have posted what they think and what I agree with of the novel in all its misguided purple prose glory so let the anti-Twilight link spamage begin:

Open your eyes Review #1

Catalogue of the absurdities of this book

Mocking commentary of some of the passages

Professional and really good Open your eyes Review #2

The ultimate rant-review

The Must-Read Parody that made it into Encyclopedia Dramatica!!!

The Rationality-Promoting Facebook Group

In conclusion:
  
(by
mswyrr
)

Wand still in your jeans? Both buttocks still on? Okay, let's go. Tonks Order of the Phoenix The Half-Blood Prince came out just in time for Harry's and JKR's birthday! I saw it yesterday thinking that I was really out of the loop that I hadn't known about the trailer by this point. It's brand spanking new and here it is: Okay, so, I was blown away. The trailer was so much more than what I expected. It was absolutely chilling. It gives me hope. True, I always get my hopes up whenever I view a good HP trailer, and then I become terribly disillusioned come screenplay. I'm just curious how Yates has delivered this storyline. HBP does in fact retain some of the classic naivety back from the CoS days, but judging by this trailer, Yates has created the darkest film yet. As the purist I am, I know that eventually I will shoot this film down. Anyhow, I dub the trailer praised by a devout fan for now. Now my customary objectively critical side: This trailer is so enticing for the very reason that its central focus is psychological horror. We're supposed to tremble at the mention of Voldemort and to see his path to ultimate darkness is naturally chilling. The trailer however successfully excluded the alleged bundles of romantic comedy moments that pepper Year 6 by layering Hogwarts with a zesty new flavour of teenage angst. What it all comes down to is how and what Yates decided to emphasise. The Riddle pensieve moments do take up a reasonable chunk of the story yet there's obviously more. The trailer makes no mention of the series of attacks and Draco's conflict of morals, not as chilling, sure, but central subplots nonetheless. What about the bloody Half-Blood Prince? The trailer doesn't allude to the grandest mystery of the story from which the title is attributed. Granted I haven't taken a peek at the new images released by WB so my review is solely on the basis of the content of the trailer. In short, this trailer serves me a delectable incentive for returning to the fandom. I promise I will go back to my delusional shipping ways and relish reading fanfic. I promise I will post once in while over at FAP and visit mugglenet. I might even have a go at the podcasts again. I was so bummed out at the prospect of the septology ending with DH. The last two movies seem like a distant dream, so to speak. I just realised that I will be on a campus with no curfews for HBP so the possibility of camping out for a midnight viewing is viable. I could actually go party like a real HP fan! I also really adore whoever came up with the idea of splitting Deathly Hallows. Would it have been so hard to have split GoF as well? Well, at least I have something to hold me until 2011. I can't let go of my first fandom. I just can't.

Greetings, I am sharing my music collection for the first time since I thought it'd be nice to give back after all the stuff I've downloaded via LJ. I have 5,900+ songs so it took forever to organise. Obviously it's too long to fit into an entry so I've put it in a word document and uploaded it: http://www.megaupload.com/?d=EHM51ZSI http://www.mediafire.com/?zwfzbj3j0v4 http://rapidshare.com/files/98328751/Music_Playlist.doc.html Conditions -Most of the files will be in MPEG/AAC Format (a.k.a. iTunes) so I'll be uploading them as they are. BUT if you ask really nicely, I'll convert them to mp3 files for you. -The default server I'll be using will in all likelihood be Megaupload, but I will upload to any server you like. Sendspace, Yousendit, Gigasize, etc. -Because I sympathise with music crazies, I'm not setting a limit to the amount of music you can ask for. Just be reasonable (if you see me overloaded with requests that I have not even gotten to yet, don't go requesting 20 albums). You can take anything I have uploaded for somebody else (rummage through comments, if you like). I might post the links back in this entry. I also don't mind if you come back later with more requests. Deadline: until two weeks from today Note: Some people might have trouble reading the music in Asian languages, so I'll romanise and/or translate if you ask. In case you're interested in requesting videos, you can check out my veoh profile here: http://www.veoh.com/users/isw1214 Below is some more stuff that's not on my iPod yet. Don't forget! Comments = Love

Dark Detectors. Basically they all show when Dark wizards or enemies are around, but you don't want to rely on them too much, they can be fooled... Harry Potter Order of the Phoenix, Chapter 18, Page 391 Yes, I just obtained the book about an hour ago. As ludicrous as it sounds, there are no legitimate bookstores in Newark so I always have to head out to Pathmark (gigantic supermarket) but at least pharmacies and supermarkets have cheaper prices. I begged and begged my mum to let me go to Pathmark at midnight (they're open 24 hrs after all) but as you might expect she cares more about my safety than my unhealthy addiction to the Potterverse. FF>> to yesterday: Heh, I cooked up a plan to have my aunt stay over so she could take me. Just to make sure, my aunt called up Pathmark to see if they were beginning sales at midnight. They always have but can you believe that they weren't selling until 7am? The last book of all books!!! At least, I didn't feel bad that I couldn't buy DH at midnight. My aunt stayed for the day anyways since we were celebrating Ala's birthday which coincides with Colombia's independence day. My grandma's made it to 85 so far; a proud accomplishment for someone that's survived breast cancer recently. A friend of my aunt's also came over to express her congrats and before her, my uncle stopped by as well. He was oddly sentimental. It is understandable since I had provoked so many strong emotions in everyone with my trip to Argentina. I will of course cover my trip in details later along with pics! It is quite a story. Well, back to HP. Overall, I felt the visits came in fine and dandy since I was much too bored to watch anime or asian dramas. Plus, I needed an excuse not to tempt myself into discovering spoilers. I can't believe that after 6 years it's over. Every moment has been so colourful in this fandom. I was ready to cry when I cracked open the cover. Based on the chapter titles, the book looks promising in terms of revealing information we've longed for for so long. Last minute predictions/comments: I read the last sentence because I couldn't resist. Oops. What I would like to happen: Harry dies and gets resurrected. How cool would that be? Ron can die. Deathly Hallows...leave it to JKR to turn a verb into a noun (I think). Since one of the book translations calls DH the Relics of Death, it sounds like hallows refers to horcruxes. My second guess is a place or maybe it's people. Oh, I'm so decisive. I don't think Riddle's trophy is a horcrux. I leave the idea open of Harry or part of Harry being a horcrux. I'm dead certain R.A.B. is Regulus Black and that the Order of the Phoenix locket is a horcrux. Dumbledore is without a doubt dead. Does that mean Snape killed him? Sure, the fall from the tower had plenty of impact but it's not definite if Snape Avada Kedavra-ed. Snape = good or evil? Bah, who knows? As much as I'd like for him to be a double agent, I have a feeling he tends to be more on the good side. Let's trust Snape or else he dies! Pettigrew will finally pay his debt. Now, I'm officially going on HP lockdown. Since I was careless, I'm gonna have to read the entire series before settling down to DH. I'm in no hurry because once I've read DH, it's all over. I would wait a year to read DH but by then I'd encounter a traumatising spoiler. Goodbye for now & good luck! ~gets tissues ready~ He had just made Harry feel rather better by telling him how he told the examiner in detail about the ugly man with a wart on his nose in his crystal ball, only to look up and realize he had been describing his examiner's reflection. Order of the Phoenix, Chapter 31, Page 717

I had to write a short essay on a contemporary or historical British person I most identify with. No one is cooler than Mr. Blake. Okay, I was opting for J.K. Rowling as well but I felt that would be overrated and that that would I don't really know any other commendable British people. 

   Of all the Britons I have heard of in either the classroom or through personal inquiry, no one strikes me in such a familiar fashion as William Blake does. While historical figures like Oliver Cromwell and Anne Boleyn do not hold much relevance to my life, William Blake piqued my interest principally because of his beliefs and works. Back in grade 9 when I had first arrived at boarding school, I had been exposed for the first time to a variety of religious views. The contact I had with students of differing beliefs led me to question whether I was in the right my own religion. Then one day, my English teacher introduced William Blake in class. One can say Blake was a deeply religious man for his faith in God yet he was simultaneously deemed a religious dissenter. It was through reading Songs of Innocence & Experience that I made a significant theological distinction: one could be highly critical of organised religion while being devoted to God. Blake impressed me most with how he made a living. Despite lacking formal education, he was able to learn on his own just as I would (admittedly, I read Wikipedia for fun occasionally). He was able to refine his education to the extent that he produced memorable poetry focusing on Christianity. It is quite inspirational to encounter someone famous who incorporates Christianity into a career without having to become a clergy member. From now on, I can live at peace with myself if I do not always agree with the Church as long as I still believe in God and use my education to personalise my religious views.

So, I was surfing the internet for inspiration on a contemporary international event and ended up learning a bit about Eurovision. In the end, I revised an old essay and submitted it but hey, I'd still like to write about Eurovision Song Contest (ESC) informally. ESC  2007, as I knew already, will take place in Helsinki in May. To my international delight, songs are in the process of qualifying as country representatives. I've watched ESC before and I never in my life associated it with controversy but today I caught up with some history. While you can't actually compare ESC to the same level of controversy as the FIFA WC, it's interesting to note the similarities and differences. The endpoint of these events is to promote peace within the international community. Of course, the goal doesn't always get fulfilled when you take in account the cases of extreme national pride as embodied by groups such as The Hooligans. They only serve to direct hostility at all people non-English. I admit that even I am guaranteed to detest the Brazilians with all my might one month every four years. 

Well, how does ESC differ from the nationalist fanaticism? Although the purpose of ESC is to establish friendly competition, you will not get as caught up with your own country for one reason: the use of language. While it's safe to call waving a flag other than your own blasphemy during the WC, it is a common enough practise for ESC contestants to sing in languages other than his/her country's tongue. Linguistic issues really aren't at the heart of the controversy though. Israel is. 

ESC '99 is pretty cool because Israel came on top with a trans-sexual called Dana International. He really does make a gorgeous woman but the ultra-Orthodox Jews had to attack Dana. 

What's worse is the recurring juxtaposition of religion and politics in the Middle East. Iranian President Ahmadinejad believes in recovering Palestine and he means serious business as he might have a nuclear bomb thrown on Israel. It's not like he has power to do anything but Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khameini isn't fond of Israel either. Israel naturally has to go make a political statement in return with a little number called "Push the Button." "Push the Button" happens to be the song representing Israel for ESC 2007. The song is decent but the group Teapacks had worthier songs for ESC. Plus every other country sings more light-hearted songs. The song doesn't stand a good chance of winning but it's nonetheless fun to listen to as is the 1967 winner Puppet on a String. 

I was searching youtube for ESC performances past and present and I was utterly devastated when I found the following song got disqualified (due to being performed too early) to represent Romania. It's so catchy that I had to post it. Enjoy.
